definition: to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)

sentences.english: Dolores, please come in and countersign a cheque.
sentences.chinese: 多洛雷斯，请进来连署支票。

sentences.english: B. Is the countersigning of checks in advance prohibited?
sentences.chinese: 是否禁止连署签发空白支票？

sentences.english: Ask a friend or family member to co-sign it.
sentences.chinese: 请一个朋友或家人和你连署。

sentences.english: I enclose the bottom copy with my countersignature.
sentences.chinese: 随函敬附已连署的合约副本。

sentences.english: CoSign is used in over 100 Part 11 compliant installations.
sentences.chinese: 连署保证用于超过100第11部分的安装。

sentences.english: Are checks required to be counter signed?
sentences.chinese: 支票是否需要两人连署？

definition: joint signatures (on a letter or declaration)
abbr. for 立法委員會|立法委员会[li4 fa3 wei3 yuan2 hui4]/abbr. for 立法委員|立法委员[li4 fa3 wei3 yuan2]
Legislative Yuan, the legislative branch of government under the constitution of Republic of China, then of Taiwan
Executive Yuan, the executive branch of government under the constitution of Republic of China, then of Taiwan
to be a candidate in an election or other selection process/to run for office/to turn out to vote
DPP (Democratic Progressive Party, Taiwan)/abbr. for 民主進步黨|民主进步党
Judicial Yuan, the high court under the constitution of Republic of China, then of Taiwan
referendum/abbr. for 公民投票[gong1 min2 tou2 piao4]
